episodeTitle: On the Verge of Annihilation! A Deadly Monster Comes Flying In!
episodeTitleJapanese: 全滅の危機 死のモンスター飛来
episodeTitleRomanized: Zenmetsu no Kiki - Shi no Monsutā Hirai
description: Luffy declares his intention to capture Caesar Clown while the Straw Hats battle their way into the laboratory. Smiley, Caesar's monstrous poison gas experiment, begins bombarding the island with deadly slime projectiles that explode on contact, killing several Marines.

events.title: Luffy Declares Intention to Capture Caesar
events.description: Luffy announces his determination to capture Caesar Clown directly while Law coordinates with Chopper to find an antidote and plans to distract Monet. This establishes the Straw Hat crew's main objective for the episode.
events.significance: Sets up the episode's primary goal and demonstrates Luffy's characteristic straightforward approach to problem-solving.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy declares his intention to directly capture Caesar Clown

events.title: Tashigi in Smoker's Body Attacks Luffy
events.description: Tashigi, still trapped in Smoker's body due to Law's powers, attacks Luffy. However, Luffy easily evades and subdues her, recognizing the body-swap situation and refusing to fight seriously.
events.significance: Demonstrates the ongoing comedic and tactical complications of the body-swap situation while showing Luffy's restraint when fighting opponents not at full strength.

events.title: Smoker in Tashigi's Body Confronts Luffy
events.description: Smoker, in Tashigi's body, attacks Luffy with more effectiveness than Tashigi managed. Luffy uses Gear Second to gain an advantage but tells Smoker they should fight later when he's back in his own body at full strength.
events.significance: Shows mutual respect between Luffy and Smoker as they both want their eventual confrontation to be at full power, emphasizing their rivalry.

quotes.text: Let's fight later when you get your body back, Smokey!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy postpones a serious fight with Smoker until the body-swap is reversed

events.title: Usopp Keeps Children Sedated
events.description: The kidnapped children attempt to free themselves from their chains, but Usopp uses his Sleep Stars to keep them sedated, preventing them from interfering with the plan or endangering themselves.
events.significance: Highlights the ongoing subplot about rescuing the children and keeping them safe from Caesar's experiments.

events.title: Franky's Radical Beam Breaches Laboratory
events.description: Unable to find an entrance to Caesar's laboratory, Franky uses his powerful Radical Beam attack to blast through the wall and create an opening for the team to enter.
events.significance: Demonstrates Franky's post-timeskip destructive capabilities and the straightforward approach of the Straw Hats when facing obstacles.

quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky blasts through the laboratory wall

events.title: Smiley Fragments Rain Across the Island
events.description: Massive blobs of Smiley's gelatinous body begin raining down from the sky across the snowy region of Punk Hazard. These fragments emit toxic gas and can explode violently when exposed to fire, creating a deadly threat.
events.significance: Escalates the danger level dramatically as Caesar's weapon of mass destruction begins its assault, threatening everyone on the island.

events.title: Marine Ship Destroyed by Smiley's Explosive Gas
events.description: A large blob of Smiley lands on the stolen Marine warship. When Marines attempt to attack it and one uses a flamethrower, the slime explodes violently, destroying the entire ship and killing several G-5 Marines including Fen Bock and Chappe.
events.significance: Demonstrates the lethal nature of Smiley and Caesar's experiments, showing the real danger posed to everyone on the island. This is the first major casualty from Smiley's attack.

events.title: Zoro, Sanji, Brook, and Kin'emon Witness Smiley's Attack
events.description: From their position, Zoro, Sanji (in Nami's body), Brook, and Kin'emon observe pieces of Smiley shooting across the frozen lake to the snowy side of the island, witnessing the scope of Caesar's weapon.
events.significance: Provides perspective on the scale of the threat and shows that the danger extends across the entire island, affecting all groups present.

events.title: Caesar Explains Smiley's Nature and Weakness
events.description: Caesar Clown appears and reveals crucial information about Smiley: it is his pet experiment created from H2S poison gas, it can fire pieces of itself across the island, it is weak against water, and the fragments are all parts of one massive creature.
events.significance: Provides critical exposition about one of the arc's major threats and reveals Caesar's role as its creator. The water weakness becomes tactically important information.

quotes.text: Smiley is my pet! It's made of H2S gas, and it doesn't like water!
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar reveals the nature of his poisonous slime weapon

events.title: Luffy Grabs Caesar
events.description: While Caesar is in the middle of explaining his experiment, Luffy's single-minded focus kicks in and he jumps up to grab Caesar directly, beginning their confrontation and catching Caesar off-guard.
events.significance: Classic Luffy moment where he cuts through the villain's monologue with direct action. This begins the physical confrontation between Luffy and Caesar that drives the next several episodes.

quotes.text: Let's fight later when you get your body back, Smokey!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: Smiley is my pet! It's made of H2S gas, and it doesn't like water!
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Explaining his weapon of mass destruction

themes.description: The episode highlights the deadly consequences of Caesar's unethical experimentation, particularly through Smiley's attack that kills several Marines and threatens everyone on the island.
themes.symbolism: Smiley represents the tangible horror of weaponized science, a living embodiment of poison gas that Caesar treats as a mere pet and experiment.

themes.description: The episode contrasts Law's careful strategic planning with Luffy's characteristic direct approach, culminating in Luffy simply grabbing Caesar while he's monologuing.
themes.symbolism: Franky blasting through the wall and Luffy interrupting Caesar's speech both represent the Straw Hats' preference for straightforward solutions.

themes.description: The body-swap subplot continues to create both comedic and serious moments as characters struggle with fighting while in the wrong bodies.
themes.symbolism: The swapped bodies represent dislocation and the importance of being at one's full strength, particularly in Luffy's insistence on fighting Smoker only when properly embodied.

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates his characteristic straightforward problem-solving and respect for worthy opponents by postponing his fight with Smoker.
quotes: Let's fight later when you get your body back, Smokey!

characterSpotlights.development: Reveals more about his deadly experiments and sadistic nature as he watches Smiley kill Marines from his laboratory.
keyActions: Releases Smiley fragments across the island

characterSpotlights.development: Shows his post-timeskip destructive power by blasting through the laboratory defenses.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the confrontation between Luffy, Smoker, and Tashigi with additional combat sequences.
Added scenes of Law and Chopper's movements through the laboratory that were not shown in the manga chapter.
Extended the Marine ship explosion sequence with more dramatic visuals and additional Marines shown being killed.
Added extended sequence of Franky and Robin fighting centaurs that was minimal in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode aired in the United States via simulcast one day before the Japanese broadcast due to time zone differences.
The episode's TV rating in Japan was 8.7%, ranking 3rd for its time slot.
This episode adapts Chapter 670 pages 2-17, titled 'Blizzard with a Chance of Slime' in English.
The eyecatcher character for this episode is Usopp with the One Piece logo.
From episode 279 to 1070, One Piece did not air ending songs to allow for longer opening sequences.
